free: #e Sir, how long have you been here?
#c 先生，你來他們這兒已經多久了？
#n M 是日繁雄先生, B 是風建福 (lahi' a taro' babayi) 先生 Note: Speaker M: Mr. Ri Fan-hsiung (Saisiyat name: ); Speaker B: Mr. lahi' a taro' babayi
#e I've been here six months already.
#c 唷，我來這裡已經有六個月了。
#e Ah, six months already. It's been a long time.
#c 啊，六個月喔，也滿久了。
#e What do you do here?
#c 那＝你來他們這裡，你做什麼事啊？
#e I feed the deer, sweep the place, and do the weeding too.
#c 喔，我照顧養的鹿啊，餵它們吃東西啊，打掃啊，喔還有，除草啊。
#e How many (animals) do you raise?
#c 啊，那你們養很多嗎？
#e They are kept in two places, thirty in all.
#c 養在兩個地方，總共有三十隻。
#e How many species are there?
#c 三十喔。那鹿總共有幾種啊？
#e Three. One is wild.
#c 喔三個，三個種類。一種是野鹿。
#e There is one more wachamaccalit.
#c 另外一種是叫做什麼來的。
#e We don't know how to call it.
#c 喔，我們賽夏人不知道怎麼叫那種鹿。
#e Two species are from other places.
#c 另外兩個種類是來自別的地方。
#e Ah, from overseas.
#c 啊，是從國外來的。
#e Right. That is wild deer.
#c 是的，那一種鹿是野鹿。
#e This species we do not have a name for it.
#c 這種鹿我們沒有名稱。
#e We do not have names. We call all of them deer. No names.
#c 我們沒有名稱，我們都叫做鹿。
#e That one passed by there and joined the herd.
#c 那一隻經過那裡就加入那一群的。
#e This kind of deer swims, like cows.
#c 那種鹿會游泳，像水牛一樣。
#e It's heard that the swimming deer.
#c 聽說，會游泳的鹿，
#e (If) the horn is sawed off,
#c 如果鋸掉牠的角，
#e (and) soaked in wine,
#c 然後如果泡在酒裡，
#e (and) medicine added,
#c 加一些藥，
#e One should drink moderately (a bit more than a half).
#c （但是）要喝少量（一半以上就可以）。
#e to avoid (your body) heating up.
#c 以免身體發燒。
#e Another kind of wild deer, it's hotter if you drink (that).
#c 有另外一種山鹿，那種酒喝了更熱。
#e Another kind of deer I'm really not familiar with
#c 有另外一種鹿我不太熟悉，
#e Like all the other deer, the horn is taken,
#c 跟其他種鹿一樣，鋸掉牠的角，
#e Then soaked in wine and mixed with medicine.
#c 泡在酒裡，然後加一些藥，
#e It can be taken by old people and by children. But the medicine added into women's drink is not the same.
#c 老人小孩可以吃，但婦女喝的藥不太一樣。
#e The medicine mixed in men's drinks was supposed to make the body strong.
#c 男性喝的藥可以使身體強壯。
#e The medicine mixed in that drink is not the same.
#c 那種飲料放的藥物不同。
#e There's one that gave birth.
#c 啊，有一隻生了。
#e One. Yesterday.
#c 一隻，昨天生的。
#e One gave birth to six cubs yesterday.
#c 有一隻生了，總共有六隻了。
#e It would be good to add (something).
#c 若加一點藥材就很好。
#e Yes, it would make you stronger.
#c 是啊，會讓你更強壯。
#e What did he say?
#c 他說什麼？
#e This is what we (need to) talk about
#c 這是我們要講的。
#e Running for elections is discovering (public) service.
#c 像這樣參選就是要找公職。
#e Is it all right to talk about this in Taiwan?
#c 在台灣講這個話題行嗎？
#e There is really nothing meaningful with elections like this.
#c 像這樣的 ... ... 沒什麼意思。
#e It really is. For what is this thing?
#e Nothing (meaningful).
#c 沒什麼意思。
#e As farmers living in the mountains, we (don't) have the capability to discuss with them things like that.
#c 我們在山上作農夫的，（沒）資格講這些話題。
#e (People like this) have the ability to run for office.
#c 像這樣的人有能力登記參選民代。
#n pa-tahoeki'-in 'town.representative' (< cau-official-pf)
#e Since the past until now, we old people have never had any problem with elections.
#c 我們老人家從以前到現在對選舉一直沒什麼問題。
#e Whoever is elected, as long as they work diligently, we will also support him."
#c 無論誰參選，只要認真做事，我們都會支持。
#e Now we know that whoever runs will have to compete with Hakka candidates."
#c 現在我們都知道登記參選的人都要跟客家人競爭。
#e (It is missing presently)
#c (目前缺漏)
#n 待補充
